Reviews.Title: Great phone!!!
Reviews.Author: P.S.
Reviews.Content: I've had this phone since December, 2011. I bought it on Amazon. I like this phone very much. Very easy to use and is a great alternative for those who want a touch screen phone, but not a smartphone. Now it's been about 10 months that I have this phone and it is working perfectly, just like when I first used it. I recommend this phone to anyone who wants a small, touch screen, LG quality phone. ATT signal is great! I live in a small town and was worried about signal, but I am always on four or five bars.

Reviews.Title: Don't Bother - Even Warranty Replacement Phone Died
Reviews.Author: Joe in NC
Reviews.Content: I am not typically a bad review writer, but this phone is the worst electronic device I have ever owned.  I bought it through Amazon for $80 with a $50 prepaid credit, so I guess I really got $30 worth of phone.Let's see - the positives: The device is attractive and easy to use, nice and small so it fits well in the pocket (watch out for key scratches on the screen!).  The menu that drops down from the top of the main screen is very useful, it has a decent amount of ring tones, and surfs the web pretty well (though the fonts are typically too small).The negatives:  The first phone I bought had issues from the get go.  It would drop calls and go into a "dead" state after a while where incoming calls got my voice mail and outgoing calls would look like they were going through, but then the 5 network bars would drop to zero and the call would just sit there and not connect.  Very frustrating, especially for my family trying to reach me.  It seemed that this state was reached after one successful call, then while looking like it was still functional (looked on, 4-5 bars network, etc) it was just dead and I would finally find out it wasn't working when I tried to use it.  Anyway, this is consistent with other reviews I have read since.  So - I sent it to warranty (after dealing with very rude customer no-service personnel) and a replacement was sent. It has been working fine for around 10 months  (and my opinion about the phone was changing) until early this week when the touch screen stopped working.  Buttons still work but touch screen is dead, and it's been over a year since the original purchase, so I'm out of warranty.  Fortunately for me, I'm out only $30, but the frustrations definitely weren't worth it.I would not recommend this phone for anyone, at all.I am putting this at the end of the review b/c I don't know if this is due to AT&T; or the phone, but there are entirely too many dead spots in the network and it just seems the network signal strength should have been better at certain times.  Could be an insufficient antenna in the phone, or just bad AT&T; coverage.And, to try to balance that out for AT&T;, their 10 cents/minute prepaid plan is awesome, so I am staying with them.

Reviews.Title: Good phone!
Reviews.Author: Danusia
Reviews.Content: I've been having trouble with my old phone so I bought this one. It works like my old one and I didn't have to update anything! Great seller too!

Reviews.Title: $49.00 for a $29.00 clearance item?!
Reviews.Author: Mrs. Moore
Reviews.Content: Well, I am sure the phone is fine, what I am having a problem with is the picture!  Why would you leave the $29.00 clearance sticker on this phone when you are going to charge right at $50.00 for it.  Makes me feel like I am getting screwed and not really enjoying it.

Reviews.Title: Piece of Garbage!!
Reviews.Author: jamie
Reviews.Content: This phone was a piece of garbage right from the start. It would freeze when multiple text were received. It also has a lousy speaker. The caller couldn't hear when you were trying to speak. Waste of time and my shipping to have it sent back!

Reviews.Title: good price
Reviews.Author: donna
Reviews.Content: I cannot really give more of a review as I have not used all the features as yet.. The reason I chose this phone was it had great reviews by others who had purchased it. I have had the same phone for around 6 years so this phone is an improvement to what I had.

Reviews.Title: LG Prime GS390 Touchscreen Cell Phone
Reviews.Author: Darrel
Reviews.Content: Although I did not purchase this phone from Amazon, got it at another another phone service will be receiving it tomorrow so I have not tried this phone yet but soon as I receive it I will try all features that I have paid for, but wanted to leave a review of this phone manufacture for now I will update this later with this phone model so I will not  give it the appropriate stars at the moment but will however leave a very good review of the LG model phone I have already, that I will be retiring only for age and got a better deal from another service than the one I was using, the phone I have is a LG300 have been most satisfied with this phone, it has given me great service, only one dropped call in the five years I have owned it and the call clarity has been awesome, I would have gone on longer with this phone but as I say found a cheaper service with another carrier and they featured this LG Prime phone so I will be using it in place of my LG 300 which I love and has been very reliable and my husband encouraged me to upgrade my phone, so these are the only reasons I am changing to the LG Prime phone, all in all LG is a very good phone and has been reliable I even have the original battery that my phone came with five years ago, never any problems, I will as I promised will review this LG Prime as soon as I can for now I will only rate it a one star until it has been rated later.
